attributes.action: WW2 British Hardened Field Defences should become listed buildings
attributes.additional_details: I think these things should be protected because they’re of national importance as part of our national history. When they’re gone, they’re gone.
attributes.background: The great majority of Britain’s static defences  have been destroyed. This started even before the war. Ditches and trenches have been filled, loopholes repaired, wood and metal recycled. Today hardly anything remains

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Applications for-listing buildings are handled by Historic England.

You can find out about the process to list a building here:

https://historicengland.org.uk/listing/apply-for-listing/
